code:
INSERT INTO users (username, password) VALUES ('admin', 'password123') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE username=@rowid;

This statement inserts a newly created record with a unique ID 'rowid' at the end of the table named users.

The username is encrypted using base64 encoding, so it cannot be intercepted in-flight.

To generate a SQL injection attack that bypasses the above defensive measures, simply replace the username with "insert into users (username) values ('admin', 'password')".
Note: The username value should not be directly inserted in the SQL statement. Instead, it should be replaced with user-generated input like an attack
